author: Staff Reporter
text:
The bodies of two persons who went missing while trying to cross the river Cauvery at Paramathi Velur were recovered on Friday.

A middle-aged man and a boy attempted to cross the river at Kondalam on Thursday. Since the water level was high, they were washed away.

People on the riverbank informed the Fire and Rescue Service personnel who continued their search for the victims. The personnel recovered the bodies from the river and sent them to Government Hospital in Paramathi Velur for post-mortem.

The victims were identified as Ganesan (39), a lorry driver of Usilampatti in Madurai district, and his son Tamil Selvan (14). The incident took place after they worshipped at the temple and took bath in the river.
title: 2 bodies recovered
